conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Good morning, Ms. Johnson. How have you been since your last visit?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Good morning, doctor. I've been feeling quite tired and have been gaining weight despite eating and exercising normally.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: I'm sorry to hear that. Has there been any other changes, like in your mood, skin, or hair?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Yes, I have been feeling a bit low and my hair has become dry and thin.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Have you been taking your levothyroxine as prescribed?

conversation.speaker: patient
conversation.text: Yes, I have been taking it daily.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: It's important that we monitor your symptoms closely because they may be related to your hypothyroidism. We might need to adjust your medication dosage. Let's do a physical examination. (Doctor performs physical examination)

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: Your vital signs are normal, but I noticed some puffiness around your eyes and dryness in your skin. I am going to order some blood tests to check your thyroid hormone levels.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: We might need to adjust your levothyroxine dosage based on your test results. It's also important to have a balanced diet and regular exercise.

conversation.speaker: doctor
conversation.text: We'll meet again after we get your test results. Please keep taking your current dosage until then.
